intro: Chorizanthe rigida, commonly known as rigid jointweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Chorizanthe rigida is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a resilient plant in desert ecosystems.
